revised_title: Fiber-Resin Interface in Composite Materials: Surface Treatments and Interactions
tldr: This article discusses the importance of the fiber-resin interface in composite materials and the various factors that influence their mechanical characteristics. The author reviews the different types of bonding that can occur between fibrous materials and organic polymers, including mechanical, physical, and chemical bonding. Surface treatments, such as chemical modification, sizing, and polymer fixation, are explored to optimize fiber-resin interactions and improve the interface properties of composite materials.
